content: On August 27, 1993, the Atlanta Braves faced the Philadelphia Phillies in a pivotal game that showcased the brilliance of pitcher Greg Maddux. Maddux threw a complete game shutout, allowing just four hits while striking out seven, leading the Braves to a 6-0 victory. This performance was part of Maddux's remarkable season, where he would go on to win his second consecutive Cy Young Award, solidifying his status as one of the game's greats.
